com.ibm.mqtt
Interface MqttPersistence

public interface MqttPersistence

MqttPersistence This interface defines the methods that must be implemented to form a persistence mechanism for the WMQtt protocol. Only publications are persisted.
If the methods defined throw the MqttPersistenceException then the state of the data persisted should remain as prior to the method being called. For example, if addSentMessage throws an exception at any point then the data will be assumed to not be in the persistent store. Similarly if dltSentMessage throws an exception then the data will be asssumed to still be held in the persistent store.
If an exception is thrown then the MqttPersistenceException( String s ) constructor can be used to add meaningful text to the exception, although the exception will not always be made available to the application if the protocol can recover from the error. It is up to the persistence interface to log any exceptions or error information which may be required when diagnosing a persistence failure.
The persistence interface will only ever be accessed in a single threaded context, so the implementor does not have to worry about multiple threads simultaneously adding and removing data from the persistent store.

Method Detail

open

void open(java.lang.String clientId,
          java.lang.String theConnection)
          throws MqttPersistenceException
Initialise the persistent store. If a persistent store exists for this clientId then open it, otherwise create a new one. If the persistent store is already open then just return. A application may use the same clientId to connect to many different brokers, so the clientId in conjunction with the broker TCP/IP address and port number will uniquely identify the connection for which the persistence store is required.

Parameters:
clientId - The client for which the persistent store should be opened.
theConnection - The connection string passed into the MqttClient constructor.
Throws:
MqttPersistenceException - An exception will indicate that there was a problem opening the persistent store. The creation of a MqttClient object will fail.

close

void close()
Close the persistent store that was previously opened This will be called when a client application disconnects from the broker.

reset

void reset()
           throws MqttPersistenceException
Reset the persistent store to the empty state. This will be used if a WMQtt connection is created with the clean session flag enabled.

Throws:
MqttPersistenceException - An exception will indicate that the persistent store was not reset successfully. The creation of a MqttClient object will fail.

getAllSentMessages

byte[][] getAllSentMessages()
                            throws MqttPersistenceException
Non-destructively retrieve all messages in the process of being sent to the broker from the persistent store. This will be called during connection initialisation to rebuild the previous state

Returns:
An array of sent messages, where a sent message is a byte array.
Throws:
MqttPersistenceException - An exception will indicate that there was a problem reading from the persistent store. The creation of the MqttClient object will fail.

getAllReceivedMessages

byte[][] getAllReceivedMessages()
                                throws MqttPersistenceException
Non-destructively retrieve all messages in the process of being received from the broker from the persistent store. This will be called during connection initialisation to rebuild the previous state

Returns:
An array of received messages, where a received message is a byte array.
Throws:
MqttPersistenceException - An exception will indicate that there was a problem reading from the persistent store. The creation of the MqttClient object will fail.

addSentMessage

void addSentMessage(int key,
                    byte[] message)
                    throws MqttPersistenceException
Add a message to be sent to the broker to the persistent store. Add should replace any data that already exists for the key.
Note that the key is unique in the context of messages sent from the client identifier. Messages received from the broker may use an overlapping set of keys and therefore sent and received messages should be stored separately.

Parameters:
key - The unique message identifier.
message - A byte array representing the message to be sent.
Throws:
MqttPersistenceException - If an exception is thrown the exception will be thrown to the application to indicate that the publish was unsuccessful. No bytes will be sent across the wire.

updSentMessage

void updSentMessage(int key,
                    byte[] message)
                    throws MqttPersistenceException
Update a key for a message that was previously sent. The new byte array should replace the previous byte array. Update is exactly the same as add except that it is giving a hint that data already exists in the store for the key. The new byte array will be a PUBREL message replacing a previously sent PUBLISH message.

Parameters:
key - The unique message identifier.
message - A byte array representing the updated message to be sent.
Throws:
MqttPersistenceException - If an exception is thrown no bytes will be sent across the wire and retry processing will take place.
See Also:
For the context of key uniqueness

delSentMessage

void delSentMessage(int key)
                    throws MqttPersistenceException
Delete a message that has been sent to the broker from the persistent store. If the data to delete cannot be found then don't throw an exception and just return.

Parameters:
key - The unique message identifier.
Throws:
MqttPersistenceException - If an exception is thrown then retry processing will be invoked which may result in duplicate QoS 1 messages. QoS 2 will not be duplicated.
See Also:
For the context of key uniqueness

addReceivedMessage

void addReceivedMessage(int key,
                        byte[] message)
                        throws MqttPersistenceException
Add a message received from the broker to the persistent store. Add should replace any data that already exists for the key.
Note that the key is unique in the context of messages received by the client identifier. Messages sent to the broker may use an overlapping set of keys and therefore sent and received messages should be stored separately.

Parameters:
key - - The unique message identifier.
message - A byte array representing the message received.
Throws:
MqttPersistenceException - If an exception is thrown then the PUBREC will not be sent and the broker will retry the send of the message.

delReceivedMessage

void delReceivedMessage(int key)
                        throws MqttPersistenceException
Delete a message that has been received from the broker from the persistent store. If data to delete cannot be found then don't throw an exception and just return.

Parameters:
key - The unique message identifier.
Throws:
MqttPersistenceException - If an exception is thrown then the PUBCOMP will still be sent to the broker because the publication has already been released to the client application. If the PUBCOMP fails to be delivered then a QoS 2 publication will be duplicated. Because of this an exception caught from this method will cause the client to terminate the connection and pass the exception back to the publish, subscribe or unsubscribe API calls when they are next used.
See Also:
For the context of key uniqueness
